node.title: Anti-domestic violence group wants media to do better
node.alt: Close-up photo of two indigenous women being interviewed
node.description: Activists say there is a noticeable discrepancy in the manner that violence against non-Indigenous and Indigenous women is reported.
node.content:
["On average, a woman is murdered every week in Australia by a current or former male partner.", "The Northern Territory has the highest rate of domestic and family homicides in the country, according to data from NT Police and the Australian Bureau of Statistics.\u00a0", "Aboriginal women in the NT are hospitalised for assault at 40 times the rate of non-Indigenous women.\u00a0", "\"It's important that we get our stories out \u2014 good and bad\u00a0\u2014 because in every newspaper article, our stories are just a little corner,\" Connie Shaw, from\u00a0the Tangentyere Women's Family Safety Group\u00a0in Alice Springs, said.", "\"It's a small story about what happened \u2026\u00a0and there's no story about how the mother's good\u00a0and what she did in her past life.", "\"It's just [about]\u00a0how she's been in a bad relationship.\"", "", "
Members of the Tangentyere Women's Family Safety Group launch\u00a0their media initiative\u00a0in Alice Springs.(ABC Alice Springs: Mitchell Abram)
", "The anti-domestic violence group this week released the first set of guidelines for journalists reporting on domestic, family and sexual violence in the Northern Territory.\u00a0", "\"How media reports incidents and issues of violence against women can reinforce drivers of violence,\" co-author\u00a0Dr Chay Brown said.\u00a0", "\"When this intersects with stereotyping of Indigenous people and other minority groups, it can increase potential harm.\"\u00a0", "Prominent activist and 2020 NT Australian of the Year Shirleen Campbell said there was a noticeable discrepancy in the way violence against non-Indigenous women was reported\u00a0compared with\u00a0assaults inflicted upon Indigenous women.\u00a0", "\"When it comes to an Aboriginal woman who's experienced and lost their life from family and domestic violence, there's not much coming out of it.", "\"As Aboriginal women, we do a lot at grassroots level.\u00a0", "\"When it comes to family and domestic violence, it's everybody's business. It's not just our own.\"", "", "
Larissa Ellis\u00a0delivered an emotional speech at the\u00a0media guidelines launch.\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Mitchell Abram)
", "Ms Campbell said reporting of assaults needed to be founded on \"deep listening\" to the voices and wishes of Aboriginal people.\u00a0", "\"To be honest, it's not going to get fixed straight away \u2026\u00a0my daughter's going to be standing here, possibly in her future, saying the same thing again. But it's all about working together;\u00a0keep doing what we're doing, as a passion. Keep going,\" she said.", "Communications specialist Mandy Taylor, who co-authored the guidelines, acknowledged there were challenges around\u00a0reporting\u00a0violence against women and ensuring cultural considerations were respected.\u00a0", "The full 'Media Changing the Story' guidelines are freely available online."]
